memberdef.definition: typedef BoardSupport ifx::tlx493d::TLx493D< BoardSupport, SPIClassWrapper, sensorType >::BoardSupportType
memberdef.name: BoardSupportType

memberdef.definition: typedef ifx::tlx493d::SPIClassWrapper::BusType ifx::tlx493d::TLx493D< BoardSupport, SPIClassWrapper, sensorType >::BusType
memberdef.name: BusType

briefdescription.para: The function ~TLx493D is the constructor of the template class.
The function init initializes all necessary peripherals of the chosen sensor board. It initializes the BoardSupportClass, the communication interface and calls the setDefaultConfig function.
The function begin calls the init function. For details see init function.

The function deinit de-initializes the sensor and its peripherals. It de-initializes the communication interface, the BoardSupportClass as well as all allocated memory (free the memory to be precise).
The function end calls the deinit function. For details see deinitfunction.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t pinNumber, uint8_t pinDriveDirection, uint8_t pinTristateDirection, uint8_t pinEnableValue, uint8_t pinDisableValue, uint32_t delayAfterEnable=0, uint32_t delayAfterDisable=0)
memberdef.name: setPowerPin

briefdescription.para: The function setPowerPin defines a power pin, which can be used to power up the sensor.

parameterdescription.para: Pin number of the desired pin.
Pin direction of the pin (OUTPUT, INPUT, INPUT-PULLUP).
Value to enable the power pin, depends on the pin (Active high or low).
Value to disable the power pin, depends on the pin (Active high or low).
Delay after enabling the power pin in [ms].
Delay after disabling the power pin in [ms].

briefdescription.para: The function unsetPowerPin does remove the power pin from the BoardSupportClass.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t pinNumber, uint8_t pinDriveDirection, uint8_t pinTristateDirection, uint8_t pinEnableValue, uint8_t pinDisableValue, uint32_t delayAfterEnable=0, uint32_t delayAfterDisable=0)
memberdef.name: setSelectPin

briefdescription.para: The function setSelectPin defines a select pin, which can be used as chip select for the SPI communication.

parameterdescription.para: Pin number of the desired pin.
Pin direction of the pin (OUTPUT, INPUT, INPUT-PULLUP).
Value to enable the power pin, depends on the pin (Active high or low).
Value to disable the power pin, depends on the pin (Active high or low).
Delay after enabling the power pin in [ms].
Delay after disabling the power pin in [ms].

briefdescription.para: The function unsetSelectPin does remove the select pin from the BoardSupportClass.
The function enablePower enables the defined power pin.
The function disablePower disables the defined power pin.
The function reset set the sensor's registers to its reset values and resets the communication interface. After that the register maps will be set to its default values.
The function enableSelect enables the defined select pin.
The function disableSelect disables the defined select pin.
Specialization of the template class TLx493D for the SPI interface.

parameterdescription.para: A helper class, which takes care of needed power pins as well user defined pins.
Specific sensor type of the used sensor.
